name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysfunction (Stage II)
chief_complaint: I have persistent pain on the inside of my ankle and my foot is starting to flatten out
symptoms: Medial ankle pain worsening with activity
Fatigue along the inner foot during walking
physical_findings: Swelling along the posterior tibial tendon
Inability to perform a single-leg heel rise
Visible collapse of the medial longitudinal arch

lab_results.MRI: Partial tearing and tenosynovitis of the posterior tibial tendon

treatment: Custom orthotics with medial arch support
Immobilization in a walking boot for 6-8 weeks
Physical therapy focusing on tendon strengthening
prognosis: Good with early intervention, but may progress to rigid flatfoot deformity if untreated
description: A progressive condition where the posterior tibial tendon fails to support the arch, leading to acquired adult flatfoot deformity. Stage II involves flexible deformity with tendon degeneration.
